brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this investigation is to assess if an intradialysis virtual reality exercise-based program results in an improvement in physical function and if it results in high adherence rates to exercise. The secondary aim is to assess the effect of intradialysis VR in physical activity level, health related quality of life and in cognitive function.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will be randomized into one of two groups. The first group will start with 12 weeks of virtual reality exercise during hemodialysis and will carry on with a control period of 12 weeks. The second group will start with a control period of 12 weeks (no exercise) and will carry on with a virtual reality exercise period of 12 weeks.
The virtual reality exercise will undertake up to 30 minutes of exercise. After warming up, participants will play to an adapted 'treasure hunt' game. Their legs movements will be the players projected into an individual tv that will give them feedback regarding their achievements. The aim of the game will be to achieve the higher possible score.They will move their legs to pick up coins and to avoid bombs. An adapted Kinect technology will be used for the game development. The exercise session will end-up with a cool-down period that will include simple lower limb stretching exercises.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will receive during hemodialysis the conditions 'virtual reality exercise' for 12 weeks and 'control period-no exercise' for 12 more weeks
study_design_info.masking_description: A team of assessors, different to the researchers implementing the exercise, will record all dependent variables

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline sit to stand 10 test at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Time to perform 10 repetitions sit to stand

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline sit to stand 60 at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Sit to stand repetitions performed in 60 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline timed up and go at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time to stand up, walk 3 meters, come back and sit down again

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline short physical performance battery at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Score achieved at the battery that includes balance tests, sit to stand to sit 5 and and gait speed

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline handgrip at 12 weeks
Change from baseline one-leg standing test at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time achieved while standing on one leg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline one-leg heel rise test at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of heel rise repetitions achieved

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline 6 minutes walk test at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of meters walked in 6 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Physical activity level at 12 weeks
Change from baseline Health related quality of life at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form 36 questionnaire to measure health-related quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Cognitive function at 12 weeks

arm_group.description: During 12 weeks subjects will exercise during hemodialysis. The intervention will be virtual reality exercise during hemodialysis.
During 12 weeks subjects will not exercise during hemodialysis

intervention.description: Subjects will play a virtual reality game specially adapted for subjects undertaking hemodialysis treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 3 months in hemodialysis treatment
- Clinically stable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recent cardiac events (less than 3 months)
- Unable to exercise
